results.title: Angus
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Michael Scott, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film portrait of Angus Mowat, with commentary by his son, author Farley Mowat. At 76, Angus still shows an enviable capacity for life, turning his hand to things that the leisure of retirement now makes possible. One of these is the rebuilding of an old fishing boat, converting it to sail. This is a picture of a man who has reached his later years with no slackening of interest in life, who finds a good and constant companion in nature, and contentment in the quiet isolation of his cabin by the shore.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andy Thomson, Michael Scott, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Angotee: story of an eskimo boy
results.creator_credit: Douglas Wilkinson, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The time is 1953 and the place is the eastern Arctic. Beginning with a scene in an igloo showing the birth of Angotee to Atootoo, wife of the hunter Koonuk, this film follows the events of a man’s growth from birth to maturity. During babyhood Angotee is secure in the protection of his mother. His childhood is free and happy as he plays games invented out of the skills he will need as a man. During adolescence he accompanies his father on the hunt and enters the company of men where he shoots his first seal. The story ends as Angotee leaves the parental igloo to set up his own abode as a family man and a hunter of the great snow-swept barrens. Awards: Durban; Trento; Toronto.

results.title: Anglo-Saxon England
results.brief_description: An outline of the history of Britain from the end of the Roman rule (A.D. 410) to the coming of the Normans (A.D. 1066), incorporating the results of recent archaeological research. Includes migrations from the Anglo-Saxon homelands, Saxon communities and craftsmanship, the early churches and Christianity, Viking attacks, King Alfred, the formation of England, revival of learning, Canute, Trelleborg and trade with the Continent.

results.title: Animated geometry: the angle at the circumference
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
Related to the basic theorem concerning the angle at the circumference. Two cases are studied, that of the angle having a diameter at one side and that angel including the centre between its sides. Series is: Animated geometry.

results.title: Angiosperms: the flowering plants
results.brief_description: The flowering plants called angiosperms, the dominant form of terrestrial plant life, are adapted to great extremes of temperature and moisture and range geographically from the arctic zones to the tropics. Shows the structural and reproductive characteristics which distinguish them from other plants. Traces the processes of pollination, formation of seeds and fruit, seed dispersal, and plant growth.

results.title: Anger at work
results.creator_credit: Ned Huckman, International Film Bureau and Oaklahoma. State Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: Explains the mechanisms of man’s personality which induces displacement of anger onto other men and impairs efficiency in everyday living. Dramatizes techniques that have been developed for handling anger, resentment and frustration

results.title: Angels and acorns: Tasmanian 'colonial' stone carvings
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird, Rodney Musch, Lindo Taylor and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates the use of Australian sculpture in Tasmania from its earliest days to the end of the last century. Work of convict origin is shown including Ross Bridge with its notable sculptures and gargoyles. Photographer: Rodney Musch. Commentator: Bert Wicks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Laird, Rodney Musch, Lindo Taylor and Tasfilm Productions

results.brief_description: A short documentary which examines certain selected aspects of the personality, ideas and lifestyle of Smiley Williams a young sculptor with emphasis on his personal vision as a clue to understanding his creative process

results.title: Angel
results.creator_credit: Derek May, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: High contrast film stock is used to give a silhouette effect. Music is by Leonard Cohen. This is a film about a young man, a girl and a dog in which the visuals are over exposed. The girl tries to fly with wings which are more symbolic than practical and the dog and young man make similar attempts. This film won awards at Columbus, Toronto, Montreal and Vancouver.

results.title: The Andes
results.brief_description: An account of the Andes mountain range and its effect on the climate, resources and boundaries of a nation. Illustrates the hazardous crossing of the mountains by foot or horse, pointing out that this difficulty is a barrier to commerce between Chile and Argentina. No other credits available.
